grammar.title: Simple Present Tense
grammar.meaning: Used for habitual actions and general truths
grammar.usage: म खान्छु (I eat), तिमी खान्छौ (You eat)
grammar.notes: The verb ending changes based on the subject

grammar.title: Simple Past Tense
grammar.meaning: Used for completed actions in the past
grammar.usage: म गएँ (I went), ऊ गयो (He went)
grammar.notes: Past tense formation varies by verb type

grammar.title: Question Formation
grammar.meaning: How to form questions in Nepali
grammar.usage: के, को, कहाँ, कसरी, किन, कति
grammar.notes: Question words come at the beginning of sentences

grammar.title: Postpositions
grammar.meaning: Nepali uses postpositions instead of prepositions

Which ending is for first person singular present tense?
practice.explanation: छु is used with 'म' (I) in present tense: म खान्छु (I eat)

practice.question: What is the past tense ending for 'I went'?
practice.explanation: म गएँ (I went) - एँ is used for first person singular past tense

practice.question: Which question word means 'what'?
practice.explanation: के means 'what' - तपाईंको नाम के हो? (What is your name?)

practice.question: What is the negative of 'म जान्छु'?
practice.explanation: जान्दिनँ is the negative present tense form

practice.question: Which postposition means 'in/at'?
practice.explanation: मा indicates location - म घरमा छु (I am at home)
